Posted By: __Silence__ (10/4/2011 9:02:52 PM)
Rating:

Turn 1
- Swamp -> -> Dark Ritual -> ;
- with Entomb Emrakul; Emrakul's triggered ability which forces you to shuffle your graveyard into your library triggers and goes on the stack;
- with cast Shallow Grave; It goes on top of the stack, above the triggered ability;
- Shallow Grave resolves, and Emrakul enters the battlefield with haste;
- Emrakul's triggered ability resolves, and you shuffle your (empty) graveyard into your library;
- ATTACK!!!

posts.post_content:
Emrakul has protection from colored **spells**, not colors, so there are any number of ways to neutralize this, or steal it from your opponent, or kill it.  
  
[Seasinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seasinger), [Captivating Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captivating Vampire), [Cytoplast Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cytoplast Manipulator), [Empress Galina](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empress Galina), [Helm of Possession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helm of Possession), [Infernal Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infernal Denizen), [Keiga, the Tide Star](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keiga, the Tide Star), [Memnarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnarch), [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker), [Rubinia Soulsinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rubinia Soulsinger) or her cousin [Merieke Ri Berit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merieke Ri Berit), [Willow Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Willow Satyr), [Crown of Empires](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crown of Empires), [Trip Noose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trip Noose), [Icy Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Icy Manipulator), [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin), [Amber Prison](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amber Prison), [Tsabo Tavoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tsabo Tavoc), [Aphetto Grifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aphetto Grifter), [Attrition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Attrition), [Diversionary Tactics](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diversionary Tactics), [Elder Druid/aut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elder Druid/aut)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Emrakul has protection from colored spells, not colors, so there are any number of ways to neutralize this, or steal it from your opponent, or kill it.

Seasinger, Captivating Vampire, Cytoplast Manipulator, Empress Galina, Helm of Possession, Infernal Denizen, Keiga, the Tide Star, Memnarch, Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker, Rubinia Soulsinger or her cousin Merieke Ri Berit, Willow Satyr, Crown of Empires, Trip Noose, Icy Manipulator, Royal Assassin, Amber Prison, Tsabo Tavoc, Aphetto Grifter, Attrition, Diversionary Tactics, Elder Druid/aut... posts.post_content: @Just1Micky the legend rule has been changed since the Kimigawa block. Both Legends die when a second come into play. At the same type, "Legendary" is now a super-type instead of a sub-type so you can't trigger the Legend rule by changing creature types.
posts.html:
@Just1Micky the legend rule has been changed since the Kimigawa block. Both Legends die when a second come into play. At the same type, "Legendary" is now a super-type instead of a sub-type so you can't trigger the Legend rule by changing creature types.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: BattleFish (4/21/2011 8:19:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Had an opponent Show and Tell this card into play. Fortunately, I had a Sheoldred, Whispering One in my hand so I threw that down. Unfortunately, he had Lightning Greaves, so I never made it to that second turn. There are few single cards that I concede against so quickly. This is one of them.  
  
I have seen this hardcasted, once. I had three [Gomazoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gomazoa)s out and two [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk)s, one of which had [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) on it. My opponent had 4 life, I had 35 or so. My opponent was targeting my Gomazoas with a [Goblin Charbelcher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Charbelcher) and [Rings of Brighthearth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rings of Brighthearth). He attacked with Emrakul, I sacrificed six lands. He killed two of my Gomazoas with the Charbelcher, but only managed to ping the remaining one for 1 damage. I proceeded to block Emrakul and shuffle both into our corresponding libraries.  
  
Do not fear the Emrakul -- for there is always hope.
posts.html:
Had an opponent Show and Tell this card into play. Fortunately, I had a Sheoldred, Whispering One in my hand so I threw that down. Unfortunately, he had Lightning Greaves, so I never made it to that second turn. There are few single cards that I concede against so quickly. This is one of them.

I have seen this hardcasted, once. I had three Gomazoas out and two Vampire Nighthawks, one of which had Lightning Greaves on it. My opponent had 4 life, I had 35 or so. My opponent was targeting my Gomazoas with a Goblin Charbelcher and Rings of Brighthearth. He attacked with Emrakul, I sacrificed six lands. He killed two of my Gomazoas with the Charbelcher, but only managed to ping the remaining one for 1 damage. I proceeded to block Emrakul and shuffle both into our corresponding libraries.

Do not fear the Emrakul -- for there is always hope.

posts.post_content:
What can I say, really? He's just the biggest, burliest, brutiest badass ever to hit the game. And he defines what mythic should be (Legendary awesomeness, huge mana cost, unique abilities, not for every deck) and shouldn't be (abilities a bit much proportionate for mana cost, but then again he does cost 15)  
  
No matter how many people dislikes its OTTness, Emrakul will always be a classic, as the most powerful Magic The Gathering Jellyfish that ever lived. My heart is filled with warmth. :)
posts.html:

No matter how many people dislikes its OTTness, Emrakul will always be a classic, as the most powerful Magic The Gathering Jellyfish that ever lived. My heart is filled with warmth. :)

posts.post_content:
"Mrs. the Aeons Torn?"
  
   
"Yes, officers, how may I help you?"
  
   
"We are extremely sorry you had to hear it like this, but your husband, Emerakul, was killed in a barfight."
  
   
"Oh!... Oh my god!... (wipes eye with tentacle). How did this happen?"
  
   
"It appears he provoked another patron of the bar, one Mossbridge Troll, and was killed due to blunt-force trauma on the, um, head... body... thing."
  
   
"But... I don't understand. Emerakul always had the highest power and toughness of anybody in town!"
  
   
"Yes, but see here? The second part of Mr. Troll's card text? It clearly shows that he was on drugs at the time, and was obviously the only one capable of murdering your husband."
  
   
"What? What the hell?! How could that happen? You mean to tell me some stupid troll just got up and beat my husband, a thousand ton, gravity defying, five hundred foot tall eldrazi god with the ability to cause the death of any six cards in the game in an eyeblink, to death with his fists? What, am I on Ca... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
